intro: Dasystephana linearis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dasystephana, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a diverse group of plants known for their ornamental and medicinal uses. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
